messageBody:
> On Monday, May 13, 2002, at 10:16 AM, vxmehra98 wrote:
>
> > Is there is an easy way to run multiple instances of the
> same test (or
> > group of tests) simultaneously both in thread mode as well
> as process
> > mode.


Umm, by your wording of Process mode and Thread mode, you may
run into some problems.

Those are operating specific terms. Some UNIX operating systems
have processes that are heavy, and threads that are lightweight.
Linux has only processes (threads are implemented as processes).
Windows only has threads (processes are implemented as threads).

So let me see what you might be wanting:

1) executing the tests in separate Threads (Java has no real concept
of process).
2) executing the tests in separate JVMs

The first is easy, and is done by ActiveTestSuite (and there is
an extension to Junit out there that does performance and load
testing...).

The second would require you to call Runtime.getRuntime().exec()
for each separate JVM you wish to run.

Those processes are *very* heavy weight, and do not stress your
class (they are in separate classloaders, separate environments
completely).

The Threads are most likely what you want as they test the concurrency
of your class the best.
